attributes.action: Save early entry maths exam for Year 10 GCSE's
attributes.additional_details:
Micheal Gove, Secretary of State for Education, on Saturday the 28th of September changed plans for year 10 students across the country to be registered for an early entry exam for maths GCSE.
If students got a better grade in the Year 10 exam, they would keep that grade rather then stick with a lower grade they could get in the Year 11 maths exam.

The early entry program would give students a second chance to secure an A* to C that the government requires them to get.
We need the early entry exam for Year 10 students back!
